page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT_LHANBRYDE
page.content: Lhanbryde is a{dormitory village. Most of the people who live here work elsewhere. Our survey of 126 of the families in school showed that only 32 parents worked inside our survey box. 131 worked outside it. Elgin was the most common place for people to travel to work,followed by Lossiemouth. Several{travel to work}in Aberdeen and some on the oilrigs of the North Sea. The parent who works furthest away works in London. Most of the parents who worked in the "box" were employed in one of the shops or public houses. The{unemployment}rate for Lhanbryde is about 10.6%(1984 figures) We asked our parents for suggest- ions that would create more jobs. They thought of :- industrial estate, an electronics / clothes factory and an old folks' home.
